title: Husband finds ingenious way of alleviating boredom of furniture shopping trip to Ikea
text:
News Husband finds ingenious way of alleviating boredom of furniture shopping trip to Ikea Fed up Alastair Colley's prank was a year in the making following his last "tortuous" visit to Ikea Share Joker Alastair Colley with wife Karen (Photo: SWNS) Share Get daily     
It's most domesticated blokes nightmare - being dragged around Ikea with the missus. 
But one husband has found an ingenious way of alleviating the boredom of furniture shopping trip. 
Armed with a pocket full of photos, fed up Alastair Colley kept himself entertained by replacing display pictures in unlocked showroom cabinets for ones of his wedding . 
The 34-year-old then messaged his wife and stepdaughter a photo of his prank - which had been a year in the making following his last "tortuous" visit to Ikea. Read More Ikea's ingenious flatpack garden for city dwellers with limited space to have a green haven of their own Alastair replaced display pictures with his wedding photos (Photo: SWNS) 
Railway worker Alastair was coerced into driving the pair to the retailer in Eastville, Bristol., on Tuesday last week on the promise of a portion of meatballs from the Ikea cafe. 
He claims to hate shopping "just like a typical man" but was determined to make the most of the trip and came armed with some photos which he stuffed in his pocket. 
Once the trio finished their meals, his wife Karen Colley, 49, and stepdaughter Lauren Webb, 25, went off looking for a double-bed for her new flat - leaving devious Alastair on his own. He swapped snaps throughout the store (Photo: SWNS) 
They were separated for less than 30 minutes when Alastair managed to pull off the funny prank without anyone in the store "batting an eyelid". 
He said: "After eating, my wife and daughter went off to go and shop. I was meandering around until I found some photo frames. 
"I took them off the shelf, nobody batted an eyelid, then just took the photos out and replaced them with the ones from my pocket. Read More The 34-year-old found open display cabinets and switched the photographs (Photo: SWNS) 
"I then messaged my wife and daughter, when I found them they were laughing their socks off. 
"No jokes is funnier than your own. I was only gone half an hour - it does not take me long to get up to mischief. 
"I do like to pull pranks like this. It's important to laugh a lot in life. Whatever prank I do, it's always done in good humour." Pal Joan Rodgers was amused by the prank (Photo: SWNS) 
The pictures are still reportedly on display in the store after a family friend messaged them a photo of her holding one of the wedding pictures last Saturday. 
Alastair, who lives in London Road, Chippenham, Wilts., thought of the prank a year ago during his last visit to Ikea 
"Not that we go that often, but I try to avoid it as much as possible - it's like being dragged around a department store," he added. 
"I'm a typical bloke in that sense - I only go to eat the meatballs. 
"I walked round the showroom and found some frames, in there were perfect family pictures which are really posey. 
"I thought it would be funny to change the photos to ones of me and my family. Read More Joke shops are shutting their doors for good as kids prefer computer games to pranks Alastair sent snaps of his prank to his wife and stepdaughter (Photo: SWNS) 
"On this occasion I was taking my stepdaughter and wife. Without telling them I took some photos in my pocket. I chose photos which would fit in with what was previously there. 
"I brought with me two posey photos I had which were on our wedding day - we got remarried in October 2014 as a celebration of 10 years of marriage." 
The photo swap is the latest in a string of pranks which date back to his childhood. Like us on Facebook
